title.rendered: Baycrest Collectors Circle Online Art Show

content.rendered:
I am thrilled to announce my participation in the Collectors Circle, a new virtual art sale hosted by Baycrest. My art, as well as pieces from numerous other artists and galleries, will be available for purchase to online audiences, all in support of Baycrest’s work to help vulnerable older adults in our community. I am so pleased to be able to offer this rare opportunity for art lovers to add to their collection.

As part of the sale, I will be offering the pieces shown below. In combination with other participating artists and galleries, this sale is estimated to have over $2 million in art value. Proceeds from the event will be benefit Baycrest’s Safeguarding Our Seniors (SOS) Campaign, which helps safeguard seniors and strengthens programs to reduce social isolation and enhance lives as we navigate through the challenges of COVID-19.

JOIN US AT collectorscircle.baycrest.org on November 16.

Partner Galleries: Abbozzo Gallery, Angell Gallery, Art Interiors, Artworld Fine Art, Bau Xi, Brian Liss Gallery, Corkin Gallery, Daniel Faria Gallery, Gallery 133, Gina Godfrey Gallery, Lonsdale Gallery, Loch Gallery, Lumas, Marcia Rafleman Fine Arts, Melanie Siegel Collection, Nikola Rukaj Gallery, Pari Nadimi Gallery, Peter Triantos Art Galleries, Petroff Gallery, PI Fine Art, Sandra Ainsley Gallery, State of the Arts, Jerusalem, and Stephen Bulger Gallery

Partner Artists: Beverley Abramson, Deborah Bennett Kagan, birdO, Justin Blayney, Bill Boyko, Adam Colangelo, Barbara Cole, Marc Cooper, Dani Cooperman, Neil Dankoff, Lindsi Hollend, Ron Kobrick, Corynn Kokolakis, Alex Kwong, Amey Lai, Ian Leventhal, Matt Pine, Melanie Siegel, Judy Singer, Gary Taxali, Tracy Thomson

content.rendered:
On Sunday Nov 24, from 1 – 4 p.m. I will be participating in a studio sale with a few other artisans and we will all be selling our hand made goods. I made a new batch of Booger the Cat shirts for the sale with various colours and neckline styles.

Vendors:

Lesley Fisher, Jewellery,
Madeleine, Scarves and mitts
Barbara Starr, Terra Cotta clothing
Margaux Smith, Artist
Eve Weinberg, Napkins and t-towels
Gabrielle Kauffman, Stoneware www.gkstoneware.com

Location:

Sunday Nov 24, 1 – 4 p.m.
5 Woodhaven Heights
Etobicoke
Facebook page:

Great Prices, Selection and Snacks !

Many bargain priced seconds
Friends, family and acquaintances are welcome.
All items are food and dishwasher safe.
40% of all pottery proceeds will be donated to
Homes first http://www.homesfirst.on.ca/

title.rendered: Home is Where the Art Is Charity Auction.

content.rendered:
This Wednesday (November 6th 2019)) is the Home is Where the Art is Charity auction. This auction is raising funds for YWCA 1st Stop Woodlawn Women’s Shelter.

One of my paintings will be available at the event. As it is an auction you have the chance to get one of my paintings for less than current value(potentially) and support a good cause at the same time.

Tickets for the event can be purchased here.

You can also bid online for my piece here.

All proceeds will go towards the YWCA 1st Stop Woodlawn Women’s Shelter.

content.rendered:
Once again I am happy to participate in the Artist Project which runs from Feb 21st – 24th

About the event:
From collectors and curators, to gallerists and designers, visitors can explore and discover works of art from over 250 top contemporary artists from Canada and abroad. This is a unique opportunity to meet and buy art directly from artists at Toronto’s favourite art fair.

Booth 903.

You can buy tickets here 

Location:
Better Living Centre, Exhibition Place, Toronto
Toronto, Ontario
M6K 3C3

Times:
February 21st: 7:00 pm – 11:00 pm
February 22nd: 11:00 am – 10:00 pm
February 23rd: 11:00 am – 8:00 pm
February 24th: 11:00 am – 6:00 pm

For this year I will be focused on the Fibonacci Sequence.
Below are some of the paintings I will have at that show.

content.rendered:
I am happy to participate in the Annex Art party this summer. It will be on Saturday, August 25 at 2 PM – 7:30 PM.

I will be selling my hand made silk screen prints and offering them for the low price of $50 each for this day and event only.

Located at
Centre for Social Innovation – Annex
720 Bathurst St,
Toronto,
ON M5S 2R4

Event Facebook page here.

content.rendered:
This year I am pleased to participate in “ifso,what“, an immersive event where an international art fair meets a pioneering music festival, complete with cutting edge innovation projects and a host of talks by leaders in the fields of technology, art, and design. While I will not be there physically, my artwork will be there and represented by Contempop NY. The event is April 26th – 29th.

You can buy tickets here 

Location:
Palace of Fine Arts
3301 Lyon St,
San Francisco, CA
94123, USA

Showing the latest works from Justin Blayney, Stanislav Plavcic, Nikola Rašković, Barney Sher, Louis Turcotte, Bojan Vidovic, Irma D’Alonzo & Riki Yao.

Opening party – Saturday, February 10, 2017, 7:00 PM – late, doors open @ 5:00 PM.
All are invited.

Location: 2381 Dundas Street West, Toronto ON

content.rendered:
Once again I am happy to participate in the Artist Project which runs from Feb 22rd – 25th.

About the event:
From collectors and curators, to gallerists and designers, visitors can explore and discover works of art from over 250 top contemporary artists from Canada and abroad. This is a unique opportunity to meet and buy art directly from artists at Toronto’s favourite art fair.

Booth 238.

Visit my profile on the Artist Project website here.

You can buy tickets here 

Location:
Better Living Centre, Exhibition Place, Toronto
Toronto, Ontario
M6K 3C3

Times:
February 22rd: 5:00 pm – 10:00 pm
February 23th: 11:00 am – 10:00 pm
February 24th: 11:00 am – 8:00 pm
February 25th: 11:00 am – 6:00 pm

content.rendered:
Once again I am partnered up with Art for All Canada and I am showing my artwork at Carlton Theatres for the months of September and October. The theatre is located at 20 Carlton St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H5, corner of Yonge and Carlton(College). You don’t have to purchase a movie ticket to se my work, it is in the lobby.

Art for All Canada Mission Statement

“Art For All Canada (AFAC) is a not-for-profit, social enterprise whose mission is to help artists to develop their skills through educational programs and to help them to market their works without paying commissions – through galleries and art shows – at the lowest cost to the artist and the lowest cost to the buyer . join our e-mail list. Our Goal is to have affordable genuine, original art in every Canadian office and home by 2020.”

content.rendered:
I was asked to participate in the 2017 Brain Project for the Baycrest Foundation. They provided me with a 3 dimensional blank brain which I painted with my pixel style.  The project was a lot of fun and my Brain has already been sponsored by Muse (they donated money to the foundation to have have their name travel with my brain), so I am pleased that my efforts have raised them a donation for their great cause.

All the brains will be touring around Toronto for next while, please let me know if you spot my brain anywhere. Also if you visit their website, they have an interactive 3D view of the brain. They have a people choice award for the most popular brain, please vote for my brain on the same page (you can vote every day!).

About the Project:

The Brain Project is a large-scale outdoor exhibit that brings brain health, art and imagination to the streets of Toronto. In 2016, The Brain Project launched its inaugural exhibit across the city to start a public conversation about brain health and bring awareness to diseases like Alzheimer’s.

As The Brain Project returns for its second year, one hundred artists from around the world will transform blank brain sculptures into beautiful, energetic and thought-provoking pieces of art. The sculptures are sponsored by corporations and philanthropists, and will be displayed in more than 15 locations around Toronto and the GTA.

Funds raised through the project are donated to Baycrest Health Sciences, a global leader in brain health and aging.

content.rendered:
I am happy to announce that I have sold 11 pieces over the last 2 months! 7 were through a commission which I cannot reveal until the client has their own PR launch (Stay tuned!) and another was for a charity which I will be able to announce this week when they officially launch their event.

The 3 I can tell you about today are Stella (sold by Super Wonder Gallery),  as well as Dasha and Vivi (Both sold by Art Interiors). It is a very exciting month and I am very happy to work with both of these great galleries, they have more of my work for sale so please be sure to visit them and follow their events. A big thanks to my beautiful models who are a pleasure to work with.

content.rendered:
I have been accepted into the Rosedale Art Fair this summer. This is a new show for me and I am grateful to have been asked to participate.

About the event:
Participating merchants and restaurants along Yonge Street from Crescent Road to Woodlawn Avenue. Over 50 multi disciplinary artists.

Location:
At the Green Space across from the LCBO at
10 Scrivener Square
Toronto, Ontario

Times:

June 10th: 11:00 am – 6:00 pm
June 11th: 12:00 pm – 5:00 pm

content.rendered:
I am very grateful to announce that I have been accepted into the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition for another year, which runs from July 14th – 16th.

I’ll be in booth 151. See map for details.

About the event:
The Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition is the largest and longest running juried outdoor art exhibition in Canada, and the first event ever held on Nathan Phillips Square. It is free and open to the public..

Location:
Nathan Philips Square
100 Queen Street West
Toronto, Ontario
M5H 2N1

Times:
July 14th: 10:00 am – 8:00 pm
July 15th: 11:00 am – 8:00 pm
July 16th: 11:00 am – 6:00 pm

Tickets are Free!

content.rendered:
A much simpler pixel pattern. Some of my patterns are inspired by objects I see in every day life, this one was inspired by my shower curtain. From this photoshoot with Morena (my model) I also created one of my favourite screen prints which you can view here.

For the next month I will be featuring the artwork that I still have in inventory. If you would like to purchase the artwork it is available for pickup in the GTA. If you require shipping please email us for a quote sales@justinblayney.com. I will be posting a new painting mid-afternoon everyday. Please like this post and share with your friends.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 16″ x 20″
Price: $1200.00

Buy it Now

content.rendered:
Depth is the first true optical illusion on canvas that I created. The black hole in the centre of the painting will grow and pulse if you watch it.

For the next month I will be featuring the artwork that I still have in inventory. If you would like to purchase the artwork it is available for pickup in the GTA. If you require shipping please email us for a quote sales@justinblayney.com. I will be posting a new painting mid-afternoon everyday. Please like this post and share with your friends.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 30″
Price: $1200.00

content.rendered:
For the next week I am pleased to announce I will be participating in the “Greenery” show at the #gallery.

I have 2 of my silk screen prints at the show, Vivi and Nebulae III.

Address:
#Gallery
830 Dundas St W.
Toronto

Hours:
4 p.m. – 10 p.m. Tues-Fri,
2  p.m. – 8  p.m.  Sat + Sun

content.rendered:
Here is a nice bright painting to light up a room. One of my original 3 colour paintings. Shown her with my cat Oreo who looks like he is about to jump. All my featured paintings are photographed with Oreo to help give some perspective on size. Feel free to make an offer.

For the next month I will be featuring the artwork that I still have in inventory. If you would like to purchase the artwork it is available for pickup in the GTA. If you require shipping please email us for a quote sales@justinblayney.com. I will be posting a new painting mid-afternoon everyday or so. Please like this post and share with your friends.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 30″
Price: $1200.00

content.rendered:
This painting really grabs your attention and takes command of the room. For months I hung it over my desk where I worked and it is currently hanging at Hatch Yoga in Mississauga. It is for sale, feel free to use the buy it now button below or message me if you have any questions. I am also always open to titles for this piece, I kind of dropped the ball on that.

For the next month I will be featuring the artwork that I still have in inventory. If you would like to purchase the artwork it is available for pickup in the GTA. If you require shipping please email us for a quote sales@justinblayney.com. I will be posting a new painting mid-afternoon everyday or two. Please like this post and share with your friends.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 60″
Price: $1900.00

If you require shipping please email us for a quote sales@justinblayney.com. I will be posting a new painting mid-afternoon everyday. Please like this post and share with your friends. It is posted with Oreo my cat to give some perspective on size.

Thank you to Noam Chomsky for the great title and education (Check out the documentary on Youtube).

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 36″
Price: $1200.00

title.rendered: …by any other name would smell as sweet

content.rendered:
For the next month I will be featuring the artwork that I still have in inventory. If you would like to purchase the artwork it is available for pickup in the GTA. If you require shipping please email us for a quote sales@justinblayney.com. I will be posting a new painting mid-afternoon everyday. Please like this post and share with your friends.

This painting was one of my first attempts at pixel art. It is a lot more abstract than some of my later pieces.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 30″
Price: $700.00

title.rendered: Art project with Vivi and Vamp is complete

content.rendered: I have just finished an art project working with the fabulous model Vanessa (Vivi the Vamp). The project consisted of a painting and a silk screen print run (available in my shop). The painting was in my signature pixel style, but for the print I went in a different direction because I was pleased with how the photos looked unaltered (not pixelated). I added a few colour variations which are in very limited quantities. I plan on adding another sepia print run once I get through the artist project.

title.rendered: Artist Project – Crystal Head Vodka Painting

content.rendered:
I’ve been asked to participate in a promotion for Crystal Head Vodka for the Artist Project. They asked me to paint this skull bottle in my pixel style.

I’m on the fence on whether to paint a pixelated face or one of my pattern, I’m leaning towards one of my patterns.

I’ll post updates of the project as I go, be sure to follow my Instagram, Facebook, or Twitter.

title.rendered: Murica prints are 30% off this weekend

content.rendered:
Possibly your last chance too own one of my “Murica” prints before it become outlawed to question the president and/or it stops being funny. Use coupon code ‘endoftheworld’ in your cart to get 30% off Murica prints.

This print is limited edition and hand made. The words that make up the image are highlights of Sarah Palin’s endorsement speech for Donald Trump.

Click here to buy this print.

content.rendered:
I am happy to announce the launch of my upgraded website dev.justinblayney.com. What is different from my old site is that I have now included an eCommerce component to my website where you can buy my hand made silk screen prints online in a few easy steps. These prints are a great way to acquire affordable fine art. Please check it out, share with your friends and I am open to all feedback about my website.

I am also still creating and selling my paintings (message me for details at sales@justinblayney.com if interested).

content.rendered:
This year I will be showing my latest artwork at the Artist Project which runs from Feb 23rd – 26th.

About the event:
From collectors and curators, to gallerists and designers, visitors can explore and discover works of art from over 250 top contemporary artists from Canada and abroad. This is a unique opportunity to meet and buy art directly from artists at Toronto’s favourite art fair.

My booth number is 539 and you can view my artist profit here.

Location:
Better Living Centre, Exhibition Place, Toronto
Toronto, Ontario
M6K 3C3

Times:
February 23rd: 5:00 pm – 10:00 pm
February 24th: 11:00 am – 10:00 pm
February 25th: 11:00 am – 8:00 pm
February 26th: 11:00 am – 6:00 pm

Tickets can be purchased here.

title.rendered: Project with Kristen Au is complete

content.rendered: I have just finished a project with the lovely and talented Kristen Au. The project consisted of a silk screen print series as well as a painting. For the print I decided to use a portrait and for the painting I decided to use a bodyscape. I plan on exploring more bodyscapes with my upcoming projects.

content.rendered:
I am pleased to have been accepted into the ‘Muse’ art show. It has a double reception, tonight September 16th and tomorrow night Sept 17th.

I will have 2 paintings at the show, Dasha and Stella.

Over 70 Exhibiting Artists!
Over 200 pieces of artwork!

Super Wonder Gallery
876 Bloor St. West
Toronto, ON

title.rendered: Media Transition Show:  Silk Screen Prints and Paintings at Centre[3]

content.rendered:
I am happy to announce that I have been given the opportunity to show my new artwork at Centre[3] in Hamilton August 2th – 29th. It is the Media Transition Show and I will be showcasing my new silk screen prints as well as the pixel paintings that inspired them.

Opening Reception:
The opening reception will be Friday, August 12, 2106 at Centre[3] in Hamilton during the Friday evening Art Crawl in the heart of James Street North. We will be open from 7 pm to 10 pm and snacks will be provided.


Price: Free

Location:
Centre[3]
173 James Street North
Hamilton, Ontario
L8R 2K9
Website: centre3.com

Times:
Start Day: August 2nd: 10:30 am – 5:30 pm
End Day: August 29th: 10:30 am – 5:30 pm

title.rendered: Murcia (pixel painting) going up on ArtBomb this week

content.rendered:
My  painting “Murica” will be going up for auction on Artbomb on Saturday June 11th.

Bidding is open 6am – 11pm EST (3am – 8pm PST). Works are delivered anywhere, ready to hang.

Murica
Pixel portrait painting,the Pixels are Sarah Palin’s endorsement speech for Donald Trump.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 36″
Starting Bid: $1300.00

Artbomb is a carefully curated, subscriber-based daily online auction featuring artwork by Canadian art stars. Artbomb is a service that delivers one email featuring one to three artworks into subscribers’ inboxes every morning – seven days a week. Bidding opens with a starting bid at 6 a.m. and closes at 11 p.m. at which point the highest bid wins the piece. All works are delivered ready to hang.

http://www.artbombdaily.com

title.rendered: Bob Weir at The Carlu, Review

content.rendered:
What a great birthday show! The night before I was at the Mars Hotel show at the Mod Club when I heard Bob Weir was playing in Toronto the next night! Ticket sales were closed and it was for a charity. I was determined not be be shut out and managed to get myself a ticket. Again, what a great birthday surprise, he did a small discussion for the charity on ingenuity and discovery and then played an acoustic set. As you can see from the photo I got pretty close.

Setlist:

Loose Lucy
Peggy-O
KC Moan
Easy to Slip
Dear Prudence
Friend of the Devil
Bird Song
Jack Straw

Encore:
Ripple

content.rendered:
I have been accepted for the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition (TOAE) 2016 again this year which runs from July 8th – 10th.

About the event:
The Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition is the largest and longest running juried outdoor art exhibition in Canada, and the first event ever held on Nathan Phillips Square. We are free and open to the public..


Price: Free

Location:
Nathan Philips Square
100 Queen Street West
Toronto, Ontario
M5H 2N1

Times:
July 8th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 9th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 10th: 10:30 am – 6:30 pm

content.rendered:
‘Systems & Sequence’ Group show at the Mississauga Living Arts Centre.


I am pleased to announce that I will be participating in the Systems & Sequence Art Show at the Mississauga Living Arts Centre with 2 other Artists, Dan Bernyk, and Sabina Rak.

The opening reception is Thursday April 21st 2016 at the Mississauga Living Arts Centre starting at 7 p.m.

4141 Living Arts Drive, Mississauga ON L5B 4B8

I will have about 4 of my pixel pattern paintings on display including the one seen above as the event photo as well as 3 of my latest silk screen pieces.

Please share and invite your friends and family, I would love to have you in attendance. The full show runs from April 16th to May 23th.


Where it is
Mississauga Living Arts Centre
4141 Living Arts Dr.
Mississauga,
Ontario
Click here for a Google map.

content.rendered:
‘The Super Duper Show’ Artwork Inspired by Super Heroes and Super Villains


Where it is
The Super Wonder Gallery
876 Bloor St W. (Just East of Ossington Subway Station)

content.rendered:
One of the reasons for my recent push into silkscreen printing is my concert poster collection, many of which are silkscreens. Here is my collection so far. All posters are first edition, and if they have any special signatures or things to note I will list them in the descriptions (I downloaded these previews from Internet so you wont see my actual copies with signatures , no reason other than it was too much work to photograph all of these). The older Blues, Jazz and Grateful Dead posters are holding up well for being almost 50 years old.

content.rendered:
‘Scape’ ‘Artwork that celebrates human architecture without nature, nature without human and somewhere in-between. at the Super Wonder Gallery.


Scape. ‘There is a beauty and ruggedness in our nature and how we’ve adapted to it. This exhibit will attempt to show the contrasts of both. From the streets and buildings occupied with pigeans, raccons, street cars, concrete, brick, business and spectical lights. To the greenery, and sometimes vacancy, trees, rock, water and samp filled landscapes. To the small town, farming field or left over human rubbage in nature, or the small dandylion growing from the side walk. This exhibit is about showing this contrast, whether it’s in one piece of art or ajacent to it’s opposite.


Where it is
The Super Wonder Gallery
876 Bloor St W. (Just East of Ossington Subway Station)
Toronto,
Ontario
Click here for a Google map.

Here is the Facebook Event for the event

Tickets can be found here, $8 in advance

content.rendered:
Season Greetings!

It has been a while since I sent a newsletter, Facebook and instagram get most of my updates and it is probably best to follow me there for the most up to date info. You can also follow me on Twitter and Pintrest.

With that out of the way, it has been a busy fall. The Toronto Outdoor Art Show was a great success and I sold a few paintings. This fall I also started with silk screen printing, I plan to reproduce some of my paintings as prints as I move forward. I have a one available now.

Art Shows

Rainbow Cinemas
Dec 1st to Dec 31st 2015

I am once again at Rainbow Cinemas in partnership with Art for all Canada. I have 4 paintings and 1 silk screen on display. More information can be found on my website here.

 

In the Studio

Colour Study
Medium: Silk Screen on Paper
Size: 18″ x 24″
Limited Edition of 7 prints
Cost: $100 / print, unframed

Experimenting with 4 colour process

Recent Commissions

Emily
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 36″

 Hailey
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 36″

content.rendered:
December 1st 2015, I will be displaying my artwork at Rainbow Cinemas which is located in the St. Lawrence market neighborhood of Toronto. Art for All Canada manages this space for Artists and I would like to extend a special thanks to them. This is my fourth year running at Rainbow Cinemas. My artwork will be in the main lobby of the theatre.

 

Where it is
The Rainbow Cinemas is located at 80 Front Street E. at Jarvis in Toronto Ontario. Click here for a Google map. When viewed from Front St. with St. Lawrence Market behind you, you will see the Rainbow Cinema sign inside the walkway.

content.rendered:
Another great show by Paul McCartney at the ACC in Toronto. Not a different show template than the show saw 5 years ago, but  great new songs for me to hear (A few of his songs and and intro stories are the same). Some of the  songs I was very thrilled to hear were, Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite!, Carry That Weight, Let Me Roll It, Lovely Rita, and One After 909. I was thrilled to hear most of them though. He certainly packs a lot of songs in and plays for almost 3 hours giving us our monies worth, quite amazing. I also picked up the concert lithograph poster, which you can see on the right.

Setlist

Eight Days a Week
Save Us
Got to Get You Into My Life
One After 909
Temporary Secretary
Let Me Roll It (with “Foxy Lady” outro)
Paperback Writer
My Valentine
Nineteen Hundred and Eighty-Five
The Long and Winding Road
Maybe I’m Amazed
I’ve Just Seen a Face
Four Five Seconds
We Can Work It Out
Another Day
And I Love Her
Blackbird
Here Today
New
Queenie Eye
Lady Madonna
All Together Now
Lovely Rita
Eleanor Rigby
Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite!
Something
Ob-La-Di, Ob-La-Da
Band on the Run
Back in the U.S.S.R.
Let It Be
Live and Let Die
Hey Jude

Encore:
Another Girl
Hi, Hi, Hi
I Saw Her Standing There

Encore 2:
Yesterday
Mull of Kintyre
Helter Skelter
Golden Slumbers
Carry That Weight
The End

title.rendered: Pixel portrait painting "Sierra" will be going up for auction on Artbomb

content.rendered:
My  painting “Sierra” will be going up for auction on Artbomb on Wednesday October 14th.

Bidding is open 6am – 11pm EST (3am – 8pm PST). Works are delivered anywhere, ready to hang.

Sierra
Portrait painting, more experiments with 2 tone images.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 36″
Starting Bid: $1200.00

Artbomb is a carefully curated, subscriber-based daily online auction featuring artwork by Canadian art stars. Artbomb is a service that delivers one email featuring one to three artworks into subscribers’ inboxes every morning – seven days a week. Bidding opens with a starting bid at 6 a.m. and closes at 11 p.m. at which point the highest bid wins the piece. All works are delivered ready to hang.

http://www.artbombdaily.com

title.rendered: Primus & the Chocolate Factory, Danforth Music Hall Review

content.rendered:
The Primus concerts were amazing.
I went to both shows this past weekend at the Danforth Music Hall and was blown away by their creativity. They played the first set with a simple stage and all their old classic songs. The second set is where the insanity began. The recreated quite a few songs to Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (Gene Wilder Version) as an edited version of the movie played in the background. Both nights I had a big smile all night long.

The second night I picked up an awesome poster from a UK show which was signed by the band. The Toronto posters were good, but the UK poster was amazing.

Songs that stood out to me were The Toys Go Winding Down, and Southbound Pachyderm on the first night. The second night, Mr. Krinkle and Here Come the Bastards. Of course the OompaLoompa songs were amazing, I had a video but it got corrupted.. 🙁

The Set Lists

July 11
Those Damned Blue-Collar Tweekers
Moron TV
Wynona’s Big Brown Beaver
Frizzle Fry
Over the Falls
Lee Van Cleef
The Toys Go Winding Down
My Name Is Mud
Jerry Was a Race Car Driver

Set 2: Primus & The Chocolate Factory

Pure Imagination
Oompa Augustus
Semi-Wondrous Boat Ride
Oompa Violet
I Want It Now
Oompa Veruca
Wonkmobile
Oompa TV
Farewell Wonkites

Encore:
Too Many Puppies
Southbound Pachyderm
Fisticuffs

July 12
To Defy the Laws of Tradition
Last Salmon Man
Groundhog’s Day

Jilly’s on Smack
Mr. Krinkle

Eleven
Jerry Was a Race Car Driver

Set 2:

Golden Ticket
Pure Imagination

Oompa Violet

Oompa Veruca

Oompa TV
Farewell Wonkites

Encore:
Is It Luck?
Duchess and the Proverbial Mind Spread
Here Come the Bastards

content.rendered:
After 21 years, I finally attended another Grateful Dead Show. It was everything I expected it to be and I had a great time. Chicago was a great city, I had a an easy time travelling around the city, pizza was the best, Soldiers Field was a good venue. I picked up many posters, but my favourite was a staff security shirt which is pictured below, it took a lot of work to get a staff member to part with it after the last night.

I know there was a lot of Trey haters, but he did a great job, awesome jams, he was the right choice. Some of the highlights for me were pretty much the entire first night, especially Wheel > Crazy Fingers > Music Never Stopped, the entire second set, and drums was amazing this show. For the second show I really liked the Golden Road, West LA Fadeaway, One more Saturday Night. And for the last night the Estimated Prophet,  Throwing Stones and Cassidy really stood out.

Here are the set lists.

July 3rd
Set 1:
Box of Rain
Jack Straw
Bertha
Passenger
The Wheel >
Crazy Fingers >
The Music Never Stopped

Set 2:
Mason’s Children
Scarlet Begonias >
Fire on the Mountain >
Drums > Space >
New Potato Caboose >
Playing in the Band
Let It Grow >
Help on the Way >
Slipknot! >
Franklin’s Tower

Encore:
Ripple

July 4th
Shakedown Street
Liberty
Standing on the Moon
Me and My Uncle
Tennessee Jed
Cumberland Blues
Little Red Rooster
Friend of the Devil
Deal

Set 2:
Bird Song
The Golden Road (To Unlimited Devotion)
Lost Sailor
Saint of Circumstance
West L.A. Fadeaway
Foolish Heart
Drums >
Space >
Stella Blue
One More Saturday Night

Encore:
U.S. Blues

July 5th
Set 1:
China Cat Sunflower
I Know You Rider
Estimated Prophet
Built to Last
Samson and Delilah
Mountains of the Moon
Throwing Stones

Set 2:
Truckin’
Cassidy
Althea
Terrapin Station
Drums
Space
Unbroken Chain
Days Between
Not Fade Away

Encore:
Touch of Grey

Encore 2:
Attics of My Life

content.rendered:
I have been accepted for the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition (TOAE) 2015 again this year which runs from Sept 18th -20th.

About the event:
The Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition is the largest and longest running juried outdoor art exhibition in Canada, and the first event ever held on Nathan Phillips Square. We are free and open to the public..

My booth will be G29, please reference the map.


Price: Free

Location:
Nathan Philips Square
100 Queen Street West
Toronto, Ontario
M5H 2N1

Times:
Sept 18th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
Sept 20th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
Sept 20th: 10:30 am – 6:30 pm

 


Opening Party

Thursday Night (September 17)

My painting Discarded will be up for auction at the silent aution opening party, details for the party and tickets can be found here. ($10 in advance, $15 at the door)

content.rendered:
Two ArtBomb auctions and a party!

My art always seems to move slowly in the summer, but once fall arrives it is time to ramp things up again. A great way to start is with ArtBomb, in the next 2 weeks we have 2 auctions coming up.

Art Shows

Nude Study to go up for Auction on Artbomb
October 31st, 2014

My latest painting (Nude Study with Pixels, please see below) will be going up for auction on Artbomb on Friday October 31st.

Bidding is open 6am and closed at 11pm EST (3am – 8pm PST). Works are delivered anywhere, ready to hang.

Click here to visit ArtBomb.
View this on my website for more information.

Artbomb and Spoke Club Party
November 6th, 2014

On November 6th, 2014 Artbomb will again be throwing a party/art show in collaboration with the Spoke Club. As part of the ticket price each guest will receive an 8″ x 8″ painting. Four of which were created by me.

Tickets are $59 each (yes, you can own one of my paintings for $59). The paintings are randomly distributed among guests in hopes that it will encourage trading among guests to get their favourite piece. Click here to purchase your tickets.

My painting “Njambi” will be on display and for sale at the show in the silent auction. Last year my painting sold in the silent auction so be sure to attend if you want a chance to own this beautiful painting.

View this on my website for more information.

The Spoke Club
600 King Street West, 4th Floor
Toronto, ON, M5V 1M3

In the Studio

Nude Study with Pixels
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 60″ x 36″

Breaking away from portraits and playing with more subtle colours and tones.

title.rendered: Contemporary Art Show at Rainbow Cinemas

content.rendered:
Starting on January 1st 2015, I will be displaying my artwork at Rainbow Cinemas which is located in the St. Lawrence market neighborhood of Toronto.  Art for All Canada manages this space for Artists and I would like to extend a special thanks to them. This is my third year running at Rainbow Cinemas. My artwork will be in the main lobby of the theatre. You could also come see a movie at the cinemas and make an evening out of the trip.

 

Where it is

The Rainbow Cinemas is located at 80 Front Street E. at Jarvis in Toronto Ontario. Click here for a Google map.  When viewed from Front St. with St. Lawrence Market behind you, you will see the Rainbow Cinema sign inside the walkway.

title.rendered: Project Gallery Art Show: Reel / Unreal

content.rendered:
Two of my paintings “Precious” and “Swing King”  have been accepted into the Project Gallery Art Show: Reel / Unreal, which starts Friday September 5th, 2014. The show runs from Sept. 5th to Sept 1oth and there will be an opening reception September 5th  from 7-11 p.m. and all are welcome to attend.

 

Project Gallery
1109 Queen St E,
Toronto, ON
Project Gallery Website

content.rendered:
Two art shows, an ArtBomb auction, and a contest!

I have 2 art shows coming up this week, the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition (click here for details on TOAE) and the Young Collectors’ Show at Walnut Contemporary (click here for details).

Even more exciting is the painting giveaway. In order to generate more Facebook followers I am offering a chance to all my existing and new Facebook fans to win my Pixel Tree painting. Just like my page and enter the contest.

Contest Details

It is very easy to win, simply go to my Facebook page, like my page, then enter the contest. Follow this link to enter the contest. If you don’t see the enter link right away, look for the Pixel Tree!

You can get more entries
This is very simple, share my contest with your friends, for each new friend (who isn’t my fan already) who signs up, you get an extra entry. So if you get 1 friend to enter, you will get 1 extra entry and they are entered as well. If you get 5 to sign up, you get 5 extra entries, and so on. Pretty awesome, right? The contest closes on July 8th 2014. The painting will be on display at the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition from July 4th-6th if you would like to get a better look.

Sweepstakes App Privacy
I know the app is asking for your personal information, this is an unfortunate condition of running any promotion through a facebook page. Facebook will simply not allow you to run a contest without using one of its partner companies, and this is one of those companies. I spent hours researching before I settled on this. I will not collect or use your information in any way.

Art Shows

Young Collectors’ Art Show
July 3rd to July 26th 2014

Walnut Contemporary is pleased to present its first Young Collectors’ Show, featuring works by emerging and established artists, all priced under $1,000. I am very happy to announce that I have been invited into the show and my painting Focus will be on display.

Opening Reception
Thursday, July 3rd
6 to 9 pm

More information can be found here.

Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition
July 4th -6th 2014

I have just received some great news. I have been accepted for the TOAE (Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition) again this year which runs from July 4th -6th.

My booth will be H35
Click here for full details of the show and a map to my booth 

Art Bomb
July 3rd 2014

My painting “Njambi” will go on the auction block on July 3rd on ArtBomb! Many of my paintings have gone on sale through ArtBomb and most of them have been sold, this one is sure to go.

Click here for chance to bid on Njambi on ArtBomb 

In the Studio

Magenta Green Pattern
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 60″

A new pattern which is working towards creating optical illusions and playing with the eye.

Ngadi
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 60″ x 36″

Inspired by local Toronto Artist Ngadi J. Smart.

 

 

Be sure to check out my Art Gallery and view my most recent art pieces.

content.rendered:
I am happy to announce that I will be giving away my Pixel Tree Painting as part of a promotion to build more of a social media presence.  This was one of my first pixellated paintings and it helped to define my current artistic direction.

Value: $800.00
Size: 24″ x 36″
Medium: Acrylic on canvas.

How to win!

It is very easy to win, simply go to my Facebook page, like my page, then enter the contest. Follow this link to enter the contest.

You can get more entries

This is very simple, share my contest with your friends, for each new friend (who isn’t my fan already) who signs up, you get an extra entry. So if you get 1 friend to enter, you will get 1 extra entry and they are entered as well. If you get 5 to sign up, you get 5 extra entries, and so on. Pretty awesome, right?

The contest closes on July 8th 2014. The painting will be on display at the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition from July 4th-6th if you would like to get a better look. Info on the show and where to find my booth can be found by following this link.

Sweepstakes App Privacy

I know the app is asking for your personal information, this is an unfortunate condition of running any promotion through a facebook page.  Facebook will simply not allow you to run a contest without using one of its partner companies, and this is one of those companies. I spent hours researching before I settled on this. I will not collect or use your information in any way.

content.rendered:
Walnut Contemporary is pleased to present its first Young Collectors’ Show, featuring works by emerging and established artists, all priced under $1,000. I am very happy to announce that I have been invited into the show and my painting Focus will be on display.About the event:
The exhibition will open up the walls of the gallery, bringing art lovers and artists together. Panel discussions will provide a platform for direct engagement and those who purchase an artwork will be invited to visit an artist in their studio, creating a bridge between the gallery, studio, and the home. Visitors will also have the chance to support their favourite works by voting for the Viewers’ Choice Award.

Opening reception
Thursday, July 3
6 to 9 pm

Chosen artists by name:
David Blatherwick • Justin Blayney • David Brown • Marc Cooper • Julie Gladstone • Julia Harris • Janet Hendershot • Jonathan Hiltz • Erin Loree • Kal Mansur • Brooke Opatowski • Anna Pantcheva • Silvija Saplys • Ilene Sova • Chris Walsh • Tim Watts
Price: Free

Location:
walnut contemporary
201 Niagara Street (entrance on side lane)
Toronto, Ontario
M5V 1C9

Times:
July 3rd to
August 31st

Hours: Wednesday to Saturday, 11 am to 5:30 pm

content.rendered:
Spring Art Shows!

As I start to thaw out from this long winter I am once again starting to travel and display my artwork throughout the city. I have 2 art shows coming up in the next two months and I have been accepted into the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition this July (click here for details on TOAE).

Art Shows

Arts on the Credit Art Show
April 12th – 13th 2014 (this weekend!)

I will have my artwork in the Arts of the Credit Art Show in Port Credit Ontario.

“Arts on the Credit” is an Annual Fine Craft and Art Show. It is a juried, invitational event meant to provide a venue for the finest artists to show and sell their exquisite work.

Click here for full details of the show and to get your free ticket!


ArtBomb Spring Art Event
May 15th 2014

I am happy to announce that I will once again be participating in an ArtBomb party. I will have my painting Njambi for sale in the silent auction and 4 of my mini paintings will be included with the price of admission to the event. So if you buy a ticket you get one of my mini paintings or another artist’s painting, and trading of paintings is encouraged. The date is May 15th and it starts at 7 pm. The price of a ticket is $55 and you can purchase them here.

Click here for full details of the show

In the Studio

Untitled
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 60″

A large pattern painting. This painting needs a name, please send in your suggestions.

 

Sierra
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 36″

Portrait painting, more experiments with 2 tone images.

 

 

Swing King
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 36″

Inspired by Frankie Manning, the father of Lindy Hop (Swing Dancing).

 

 

My Facebook page has taken over a bit from my newsletter, it is more day to day behind the scenes progress updates as well as cool art from other artists. Please click here to join and like my new Facebook group if you haven’t already. I will continue the newsletter, but you will get more information on my Facebook page.

content.rendered:
I have just received some great news. I have been accepted for theTOAE (Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition) again this year which runs from July 4th -6th.

About the event:
Now in its 53nd year, the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition [TOAE] is a juried showcase featuring contemporary fine art and craft that takes place annually on Nathan Phillips Square, every July.

My booth will be H35

As the largest juried outdoor art exhibition in Canada, TOAE offers a fresh-air alternative to conventional art shows and galleries. Hundreds of artists participate and an estimated 100,000 visitors attend the exhibition every year. Side by side, established artists, undiscovered talents and innovative students sell their work directly to the public and make lasting connections with art dealers and collectors.

Price: Free

Location:
Nathan Philips Square
100 Queen Street West
Toronto, Ontario
M5H 2N1

Times:
July 4th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 5th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 6th: 10:30 am – 6:30 pm

title.rendered: ArtBomb Spring Art Event – Contemporary Art Show

content.rendered:
ArtBomb Spring Art Event at The Oakville Club.

I am happy to announce that I will once again be participtaing in an ArtBomb party. I will have my painting Njambi for sale in the silent auction and 4 of my mini paintings will be randomly gven away with admission (as well as other artists work). So you have a chance to get one of mine or another artists, and trading is encouraged. The date is May 15th and it starts at 7 pm.


Price: $55.00
Purchase tickets here



Where it is
The Oakville Club
56 Water Street,
Oakville,
Ontario
Click here for a Google map.

Here is the flyer for the event

title.rendered: Swing King painting debuts at Rainbow Cinemas Gallery

content.rendered:
Today I am setting up a new art show at Rainbow Cinemas Gallery in Market Square Toronto. My latest painting titled “Swing King” which was just finished will be one of the 6 paintings on display at the show. Swing King is inspired by Frankie Manning, the father of Lindy Hop (Swing Dancing). The pixels are dancing shoes. The show will hang for the entire month of March.

The Rainbow Cinemas is located at 80 Front Street E. at Jarvis in Toronto Ontario. Inside the theatre entrance are large glass display walls which you can view without going to a movie, my paintings are within one of those walls. Visit my art show page for more detailed directions and instructions.

Toronto, ON

title.rendered: Arts on the Credit Art Show

content.rendered:
I will have my artwork in the Arts of the Credit Art Show in Port Credit Ontario.

“Arts on the Credit" is an Annual Fine Craft and Art Show. It is a juried, invitational event meant to provide a venue for the finest artists to show and sell their exquisite work.

"Arts on the Credit" will be held at the Waterside Inn, in the village of Port Credit, on April 12 & 13, 2014, 11-5.

Where it is
The Waterside Inn
15 Stavebank Road South,
Mississauga,
Ontario
Click here for a Google map.

More information about the show can be found here.

Here is a complimentary ticket you can print and bring to get into the event for free.

content.rendered:
Starting on March 1st 2014, I will once again display my artwork at Rainbow Cinemas which is located in the St. Lawrence market neighborhood of Toronto.  Art for All Canada manages this space for Artists and I would like to extend a special thanks to them.

My artwork will be in the main lobby of the theatre, I have not yet picked what pieces will be up, it will be a mix of my pixel portrait and pattern paintings. You could also come see a movie at the cinemas and make an evening out of the trip. 

Where it is

The Rainbow Cinemas is located at 80 Front Street E. at Jarvis in Toronto Ontario. Click here for a Google map.  When viewed from Front St. with St. Lawrence Market behind you, you will see the Rainbow Cinema sign inside the walkway.

title.rendered: Furthur Paradise Waits Review at Riviera Maya

content.rendered:
Last week I had the extreme good fortune to attend the Furthur concerts at the Hard Rock Resort, Riviera Maya, Mexico. Twenty-five years ago when I first started seeing the Grateful Dead, we typically drove around in beat up vans or cars, and slept in the back seat at rest areas and parking lots. At these shows in mexico, we stayed at an all-inclusive 4 star resort and received foot massages between shows (dancing on concrete is hard on your feet).

I seen the Grateful Dead play 150 times and Furthur only once before this and I have to say they were at the top of their game. As far as the shows go, all I can say is Mind Blown! Perhaps I say that every time, or maybe it is because in the last 20 years I have only seen Bob and Phil play 3 or 4 times. I also caught the surprise Bob Weir acoustic set, I got front row for that.

Recently I have been on a Pig Pen era kick, I pretty much only listen to shows pre 1973 and have been loving all the older songs which the dead never played in the 90s when I was touring, so I was really excited that Furthur has brought back the old repertoire . I know the last 4 years they have played it all, yet I never got to hear it live though. I got to hear many songs for the first time, Cosmic Charlie, Pride of Cucamonga, Unbroken Chain, Viola Lee Blues, Mason’s Children, Cryptical Envelopment, The Mountain Song,  St. Stephen, The Golden Road, Eleven, Death Don’t Have No Mercy, and At a Siding / Terrapin Flyer.

The best part of the shows was the second set of the last night, Dark Star  > Morning Dew > Dark Star > St. Stephen > Eleven > Death Don’t Have No Mercy. I wanted to hear those songs, but in that order in the original way they used to play it was too much to ask. So Grateful.

Here are the setlists:

January 20th
Set 1:
Feel Like a Stranger
Crazy Fingers >
China Cat Sunflower >
Cassidy
Althea
Loose Lucy
Cosmic Charlie

Set 2:
Help on the Way  >
Slipknot! >
Let It Grow >
Eyes of the World >
Wharf Rat >
Let It Grow>
Jam >
Playing in the Band >
Dear Mr. Fantasy >
In the Midnight Hour

Encore:
Franklin’s Tower

January 21st
Set 1:
Hell in a Bucket >
Brown-Eyed Women
Me and My Uncle >
Mexicali Blues
Loser
Pride of Cucamonga
Bertha >
Good Lovin’ >
La Bamba >
Good Lovin’

Set 2:
Truckin’  >
Deal
Terrapin Station  >
Unbroken Chain >
Viola Lee Blues >
Dear Prudence >
Shakedown Street  >
Sugar Magnolia

Encore:
Ripple

January 22nd
Set 1:
Mason’s Children >
Jack Straw
Here Comes Sunshine >
Cumberland Blues
Bird Song >
Lost Sailor >
Saint of Circumstance

Set 2:
Uncle John’s Band >
The Wheel >
Cryptical Envelopment >
The Other One >
Cryptical Envelopment >
Standing on the Moon >
Scarlet Begonias >
Reuben & Cherise (Mind Blown!!!) >
Fire on the Mountain >

Encore:
Box of Rain

January 23rd
Set 1:
The Music Never Stopped
Built to Last
Estimated Prophet >
Foolish Heart >
Sugaree
The Mountain Song >
I Know You Rider

Set 2:
The Golden Road (To Unlimited Devotion) >
Dark Star >
Morning Dew >
Dark Star >
St. Stephen >
Eleven >
Death Don’t Have No Mercy >
At a Siding / Terrapin Flyer >
Not Fade Away >

Encore:
Brokedown Palace

Bob Weir Surprise Acoustic Set – January 23rd
K.C. Moan
When I Paint My Masterpiece
Black Throated Wind
Loose Lucy
Peggy-O
Not Fade Away (tease)
Easy To Slip
Not Fade Away

5/5 Stars

title.rendered: January Newsletter – New Year and New Art!

content.rendered:
It has been quite busy over the holidays. I have been creating lots of new artwork and was invited into some new art galleries. Artbomb had 2 parties over the holidays and I had success selling 2 of my paintings at these parties, both Amelie and Engineered Beauty were taken into new homes. I now have 2 art shows that are currently running in Toronto and one that is starting next week in Mississauga.

I also have a new Facebook page just for my artwork, please click here to join and like my new Facebook group if you haven’t already. On this page I post photos of my new work as it is being developed as well as great art from other artists.

Art Shows

Visual Arts Mississauga’s
36th Annual Juried Show of Fine Art
January 16th – February 22nd 2014

My painting “Njambi” has been accepted into the Visual Arts Mississauga 36th Annual Juried Show of Fine Art which is on display at the Art Gallery of Mississauga.

Opening Reception:
Thursday, January 16th, 6 pm
Click here for full details of the show

Project Gallery – “Only New Art”
January 2nd – 15th 2014

My latest painting “Scrollin” has been accepted into the Project Gallery Art Show – “Only New Art”, which starts Thursday Jan 2nd 2014. The show runs from Jan 2nd to Jan 15th. All are welcome to attend.
Click here for full details of the show

 

Walnut Contemporary’s “Little Salon”
December 5th 2013 – January 23rd 2014

My painting “Discarded” has just been accepted into the Walnut Contemporary’s “Little Salon” group art show from December 5th to January 23rd.
Click here for full details of the show

In the Studio

Samantha
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 36″

Portrait pixel painting. Playing with different shaped pixel backgrounds to give it a motion effect.

 

Be sure to check out my Art Gallery and view my most recent art pieces.

title.rendered: Project Gallery Art Show – Only New Art

content.rendered:
My latest painting “Scrollin” has been accepted into the Project Gallery – Only New Art, Art Show which starts Thursday January 2nd, 2014. The show runs from Jan 2nd to Jan 15th and there will be an opening reception Jan 2nd from 7-11 p.m. and all are welcome to attend.

Project Gallery
1109 Queen St E,
Toronto, ON

content.rendered:
Last night I attended an awesome party hosted by Art Battle & ArtBomb at the Steam Whistle Brewery.  The night consisted of a 45 minute Art Battle and a silent auction of ArtBomb artist paintings including my own. I had a last-minute change of paintings, originally my painting Samantha was supposed to be at the event but we ended up having Engineered Beauty in the auction. I am happy to say that the painting was sold.

The art battle artists are all talented, and I am amazed that they can produce such great work in 45 minutes and in front of a crowd. Two paintings that really impressed me are below. The painting on the left is by Keito Morimoto and the right is painted by Danilo Ursini.

content.rendered:
I have just finished 2 new paintings using the same model and photograph but with quite different effects.

Both of these pieces will be available at the ArtBomb and Art Battle Holiday coming up on December 18th. This party will be full of great Canadian art and artists.

For the larger sized painting we have more pixels and detail with 2 types of blue pixels in the background. An optical illusion is created when the blue pixel background is seen against the black and white foreground. The effect is that the background seems to disappear when held up against the lighter colours.

The second painting is much smaller so the effect ends up being very abstract. I alternated the pixel background with orange and blue as well.

title.rendered: Visual Arts Mississauga Juried Show at Art Gallery of Mississauga

content.rendered:
My painting “Njambi” has been accepted into the Visual Arts Mississauga 36th Annual Juried Show of Fine Art which is on display at the Art Gallery of Mississauga.

The show runs from January 16th to Februrary 22nd 2014.

Opening Reception: 
Thursday, January 16, 6 pm

All are invited to attend the Opening Reception. Admission to the Gallery is FREE

Location
Art Gallery of Mississauga
300 City Centre Dr
Mississauga, ON

title.rendered: Holiday Art Bash with ArtBomb and Art Battle

content.rendered:
Art Battle and Art Bomb are teaming up to throw the year’s biggest Holiday Art Party!

Join us in the Steamwhistle Brewery’s beautiful Roundhouse room on December 18th as we showcase over 100 of Toronto’s hottest artists from the Art Bomb and Art Battle communities! What’s planned for the night:

  • Live competitive painting with advanced bonus auction
  • One hundred ‘Secret Santa’ gift wrapped works for sale
  • Live auction of Studio (12) and large format Art Battle (12) works
  • DJ duo We Were Born Electric performs all night!
  • Free Poutine from Poutini’s
  • Cash bar

At this show my newest painting “Samantha” will be up for silent auction.  My secret Santa gift will be “Sam”, which is a much smaller and more abstract version of Samantha.

Tickets can be purchased here

Art Battle Art Bomb Holiday Art Bash
December 18th 7pm

Steamwhistle Brewery
The Roundhouse, 255 Bremner Blvd.
Toronto, ON,
M5V 3M9

title.rendered: Eddie Izzard at Massey Hall: Nov 13th

content.rendered:
Last week I was pleased to catch Eddie Izzard at Massey Hall in Toronto.

I have been waiting for a chance to see him live after discovering him on youtube, most notably his Death Star Canteen bit (which he used to launch new new jokes at this show).

I loved his style, he would kind of ramble on about many topics and then tie them all together. Of course he took advantage of Toronto’s infamous Mayor Rob Ford for many jokes.


5/5 Stars

Eddie Izzard
November 13th
Massey Hall
178 Victoria St
Toronto,
ON
M5B 1T7

title.rendered: Darkstar Orchestra at Danforth Music Hall: Nov 14

content.rendered:
My favorite cover band came back into town last week, Darkstar Orchestra. They replicate Grateful Dead concerts and do an amazing job at it too.

For this concert they played a show from  April 4th 1982 , Cameron Indoor Stadium – Duke University Durham NC. For an extra encore they threw in “My Sisters And Brothers” which was a Jerry Garcia Band staple and awesome to hear live.

If I had any complaints it would only be for the venue, the floors are slanted which makes it a bit tricky to dance on.


4/5 Stars

Darkstar Orchestra
November 14th
Danforth Music Hall
147 Danforth Ave
Toronto,
ON
M4K 1N2

title.rendered: Two Canadian Art Shows for November

content.rendered:
Over the last 2 weekends I was lucky enough to get out and go to a few art shows, one being the Spoke Club / Artbomb show I have wrote about already and the other 2 were for Canadian artists Kyle Tonkens and Christine Mathews.

A few months back Kyle honoured me by creating a painting based on colours I provided him, I chose Cerulean Blue and Cadmium Orange and he created the piece to the right based on that. This is just one of the great paintings you can see at the show.

His show runs from November 2nd to November 20th, 2013. The art gallery is:

GNSTUDIO
Address:
123 Lakeshore Rd W,
Oakville, ON L6K 1E2
Phone:
(905) 901-0093
www.gnstudio.ca


One of Christine Mathews pieces that jumped out at me is to the right. It is a mixed media piece consisting of paint and plaster. You can see more of her work at www.cmbear.org

Her shows runs for the month of November at:

Earthbound Organic Food Market
Address:
370 Wilson street East,
Ancaster, Ontario L9G 4S4
Phone:
(289) 204-1152

content.rendered:
I am pleased to announce and reveal my latest painting which is titled “Njambi”. I am very pleased with this painting and it will be the second painting (the first piece being Amelie) in a new direction towards more subtle and abstract paintings.

With this painting I played with 2 different shaped pixels and added a highlight background behind every pixel shape.

I will be submitting this piece to a Canadian art show, more details to follow if it is accepted into the show.

content.rendered:
New Shows and New Artwork!

It has been awhile since my last newsletter, I have been busy though. I have 4 art shows coming up in the next month and a half, I will briefly list them here with links back to my website with the full details. I also have a new facebook page just for my artwork, please click here to join and like my new Facebook group.

Art Shows

Artbomb and Spoke Club Party: November 7th, 2013 
On November 7th, 2013 Artbomb with be throwing a party/art show in collaboration with the Spoke Club. As part of the ticket price each guest will receive an 8″ x 8″ painting. Two of which were created by me and can be seen below. My painting “Amelie the Dancer” will also be for sale at this show.
Full details of the show are here.
You can buy tickets to the event here.

Toronto Lindy Hop’s Annual Cabaret: November 30th, 2013
I will have 1 painting (my latest piece) on display and available for purchase at Toronto Lindy Hop’s Annual Cabaret.
Full details of the show are here.

Christmas Studio Art Sale: December 1st, 2013
On December 1st, 2013, I will be taking part in a Christmas Studio Art Show & Sale. For this event I will be focussing on my geometric pattern paintings.
Full details of the show are here.

Walnut Contemporary’s “Little Salon”: December 5th 2013
My painting “Discarded” has just been accepted into the Walnut Contemporary’s “Little Salon” group art show from December 5th to January 23rd.
Full details of the show are here.

In the Studio

Engineered Beauty
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 36″

Pixel painting using 4 different shapes for pixels; circles, squares, triangles, and hexagons.


 

 

 

 

Amelie
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 30″

Amelie the dancer.

content.rendered:
On December 1st, 2013, I will be taking part in a Christmas Studio Art Show & Sale. For this event I will be focussing on my geometric  pattern paintings. The show includes other artists and art forms including pottery, clothing, handmade calendars and jewellery, live jazz, homemade cookies, wine cheese, coffee and cider. For more information visit the Facebook page created for the event.

Christmas Studio Art Show & Sale
5 Woodhaven Hts
Etobicoke
Times: 1-4 p.m.

title.rendered: Contemporary painting "Engineered Beauty" is now complete

content.rendered:
My latest painting which is titled “Engineered Beauty” has just been finished. It is a pixel painting using 4 different shapes for pixels; circles, squares, triangles, and hexagons.

This painting was inspired by a dancer and friend. This is my second contemporary painting to be inspired by a dancer. It will be on display at Toronto Lindy Hop’s Annual CABARET on November 30th! More information about the event is here.

title.rendered: Walnut Contemporary's "Little Salon: These Post-Neo-Pop Like Days" group art show in Toronto

content.rendered:
My painting “Discarded” has just been accepted into the Walnut Contemporary’s “Little Salon: These Post-Neo-Pop Like Days” group art show from December 5th to January 23rd. This will be my first showing with this gallery and I am excited to be a part of this show.

Opening Reception:
Friday, December 06, 6 to 9 pm.

The show runs until January 23, 2014

Walnut Contemporary
www.walnutcontemporary.com
201 Niagara Street (entrance on side lane)
Toronto, ON
M5V 1C9

Hours: Wednesday to Saturday, 11 am to 5:30 pm
(or by appointment)

title.rendered: Sorry my website is slow – Bluehost website hosting review

content.rendered:
I apologize for my website being extremely slow and down most for most of the time during the last week as well as my email. My web hosting company Bluehost.com is being being attacked by disgruntled users because of their bad service, the attack is called a DDOS attack. The result of which is that they have to suppress all the websites and email on the server being attacked. They do have a easy fix which I have requested many times which is to put my websites on a server which is not under attack, but they refuse to do so, telling me that if they did this for me, they would have to do it for every customer who asked and I just have to wait it out (I am  paying for a service that is not being delivered).

Because of this lack of responsiveness and refusal to easily fix the problem, I am giving Bluehost.com a rating of 1/5 and I apologize to anyone I may have recommended this company to in the past. I will be finding another company to do business with as soon as I can get normal access to my website.

October 14, 2013

content.rendered:
Thurston Moore’s new band, Chelsea Light Moving played in Hamilton and I was very pleased to catch it. As a long standing Sonic Youth fan I was amazed that I got to see this for free at Hamilton’s street festival, Supercrawl. While Thurston may cringe to hear this, what I liked most about it was that is sounded just like new Sonic Youth songs, which is what I came to hear. It was very surreal music with the occasional punk/thrashy edge. I hope to hear more of Chelsea Light Moving in the future.I don’t have a setlist to give, if one pops up online I will repost it.


5 / 5 Stars

title.rendered: Artbomb and Spoke Club Party November 7th 2013

content.rendered:
On November 7th, 2013 Artbomb with be throwing a party/art show in collaboration with the Spoke Club. As part of the ticket price each guest will receive an 8″ x 8″ painting. Two of which were created by me and can be seen below.

No webpage has been created for the event yet, all I can tell you is that tickets are $50 each (yes, you can own one of my paintings for $50).  The paintings are randomly distributed among guests in hopes that it will encourage trading among guests to get their favourite piece.

Artbomb website

The Spoke Club
600 King Street West, 4th Floor
Toronto, ON, M5V 1M3


Update:
My painting “Amelie the Dancer” Will be on display and for sale at the show.

Amelie the dancer

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 30″

title.rendered: Contemporary Artist Kyle Tonkens creates painting from my colours

content.rendered:
I have been recently honored by Artist Kyle Tonkens. He contacted me and asked me to pick some colours which he then used for a painting which he named “Justin Blayney’s Choices”.

The colours I chose where Cerulean Blue and Cadmium Orange and this is the great painting that Kyle created with those colours.

Please check out his website.

content.rendered:
After 20 years I finally made it inside a Phish concert and I was totally blown away on how great they were. I was shut outside of many Phish shows at some great California venues (Warfield, Wiltern Theatre, Greek theatre and more I’m sure) back when I was following the Grateful Dead.

Anyways, lots of great jamming, I plan to see the whenver possible from now on, below is the setlist.

Set 1:
The Moma Dance >
Chalk Dust Torture
Undermind
Army of One
Halley’s Comet >
Twist
Bouncing Around the Room
Stash, Yarmouth Road
Tube >
Ocelot >
Suzy Greenberg

Set 2:
Down with Disease >
Also Sprach Zarathustra >
Free >
Piper >
Tweezer >
Silent in the Morning >
Backwards Down the Number Line >
Cavern >
David Bowie

Encore:
Loving Cup >
The Squirming Coil
Tweezer

5/
5stars

Justin Blayney

title.rendered: Spock painting is for sale online at Artbomb!

content.rendered:
On Sunday August 4th my painting Spock will go up for auction on Artbomb!

I have had some great success with Artbomb over the last couple of months, they have sold 2 of my paintings, At Ease and Blazing Heart. So be sure to on the website that day if you have any interest in the Spock painting, as it is sure to sell.

About Artbomb
Artbomb is a carefully curated, subscriber-based daily online auction featuring artwork by Canadian art stars. Launched in December, 2011, Artbombdaily.com is a brand new, successful way for artists to market and sell their work to thousands of potential buyers.

title.rendered: July 2012 Newsletter – Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition

content.rendered:
Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition in 2 days!

I have been accepted to TOAE (Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition) again this year which runs from July 5th -7th. My booth is 225, please see the map for more details about my location.

Show Times:
July 5th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 6th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 7th: 10:30 am – 6:30 pm

Location:
Nathan Philips Square
100 Queen Street West
Toronto, Ontario
M5H 2N1

As the largest juried outdoor art exhibition in Canada, TOAE offers a fresh-air alternative to conventional art shows and galleries. Hundreds of artists participate and an estimated 100,000 visitors attend the exhibition every year. Side by side, established artists, undiscovered talents and innovative students sell their work directly to the public and make lasting connections with art dealers and collectors.

Visit my website for more information

ArtBomb

Last month on Artbomb, my painting At Ease was sold! There was a lot of interest, so I will have 2 more paintings go up for auction soon. Blazing Heart and Focus are the paintings that will go up on the auction block.

In the Studio

Erg Chebbi

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 36″

Inspired by a recent trip to Morocco and the Erg Chebbi Sand Dunes. Continuing to play with different shaped pixels.

 

 

Precious

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 40″ x 30″

Inspired by one of my favourite stories.

Be sure to check out my Art Gallery and view my most recent art pieces.

content.rendered:
My latest painting is done and just in time too, it will be on display at my booth at TOAE (click for info).

This painting of Gollum is inspired by a story I have been ready every few years since I was a child. I tend to do that with books I like, wait 2-3 years after reading them so I forget just enough to enjoy them again. All comments and feedback are welcome.

Precious
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 40″ x 30″

content.rendered:
What an awesome concert, Primus delivers yet again (my 3rd or 4th show). My first 3D concert experience was amazing (I could only imagine if the Grateful Dead or Pink Floyd had this 3D technology at their disposal what they would do). I was also very happy to pick up the Primus limited edition poster for my concert poster collection (I just started it).  It was also nice to see Salad Fingers on the screen during the first song.

This was my first show at the Danforth Music Hall and I had no complaints, a great venue, the sound was good and clear, and the seats were comfy.

I just discovered that Primus plays different shows in consecutive shows, if I had of known before hand I would have gone both nights (they played my favourite song, “The Toys Go Winding Down” on the first night.. sniff).

Here is the setlist:

Set 2
Those Damned Blue-Collar Tweekers
Duchess and the Proverbial Mind Spread
Extinction Burst
Frizzle Fry
Over the Falls
Tragedy’s a’ Comin’
Bob
Jerry Was a Race Car Driver

Set 2
HOINFODAMAN (Rush’s “The Trees” intro)
Dirty Drowning Man
The Pressman
Eternal Consumption Engine
Jilly’s on Smack
Eleven (w/drum intro)
Del Davis Tree Farm
Hamburger Train
Harold of the Rocks

Encore:
Fisticuffs
Tommy the Cat

title.rendered: My latest contemporary painting – Erg Chebbi

content.rendered:
I am pleased to present my latest painting to the online world which is titled Erg Chebbi. It is named after the place I took the original photo, the Erg Chebbi Sand Dunes in Morocco.

This painting continues in my theme of using different shaped pixels on the same canvas and starting to break away from the more structured grid pieces I have been doing over the last few years (not breaking away much, but a bit).

The painting is 36 inches square and acrylic on canvas. This painting is available for purchase. All comments and feedback are welcome.

title.rendered: Contemporary Art Show in Toronto, Canada: TOAE, July 5-7th 2013

content.rendered:
I have just received some great news. I have been accepted to TOAE (Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition) again this year which runs from July 5th -7th.About the event:
Now in its 52nd year, the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition [TOAE] is a juried showcase featuring contemporary fine art and craft that takes place annually on Nathan Phillips Square, every July.

As the largest juried outdoor art exhibition in Canada, TOAE offers a fresh-air alternative to conventional art shows and galleries. Hundreds of artists participate and an estimated 100,000 visitors attend the exhibition every year. Side by side, established artists, undiscovered talents and innovative students sell their work directly to the public and make lasting connections with art dealers and collectors.

Location:
Nathan Philips Square
100 Queen Street West
Toronto, Ontario
M5H 2N1

Times:
July 5th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 6th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 7th: 10:30 am – 6:30 pm

title.rendered: Contemporary toronto art show this weekend: Arts on the Credit

content.rendered: This weekend I am attending Arts on the Credit at the Waterside Inn in Port Credit Mississauga. Please come out to support myself and 30 other artists. There is quite a bit of contemporary art as well as many craftsman selling their work at this event. More information on the Art Show page.

content.rendered:
The summer is almost here which signals the beginning of quite a few art shows for me. It all starts this weekend at Arts of the Credit, then 2 weeks from now at Insomnia Restaurant on Bloor St. west. Starting at the end of May look for me at ArtBomb, a Canadian online art auction. Details for everything are below.

Arts on the Credit

April 27th and 28th I will once again be at Arts on the Credit with all of my art for sale along with 30 other artists and craftsman. Last year was a great event and I am looking forward to attending again. If you are attending, please print the complimentary admission ticket and bring with you. For this show I have received some media attention and done some promotion. Visit my press release page and you will find links for a TV interview on Rogers Daily and radio interview on HazeFM.

Show Dates:
April 27-28, from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Waterside Inn
15 Stavebank Road South,
Mississauga,
Ontario L5G 2T2
toll-free: (877) 264-7770
(905) 891-7770
Visit my website for more information

Insomnia Restaurant & Lounge

I am pleased to announce that for the month of May my artwork will be on display at Insomnia Restaurant & Lounge on Bloor St., Toronto. I will be hanging on May 6th and open to the public on May 7th for 1 month. I have quite a bit of space at Insomnia and most of my work will be on display. It will be a good mix of my pixelated portrait and pattern paintings.

On May 7th there will be an informal reception at the Restaurant at 8 p.m. All are welcome to attend to come and enjoy the great food and atmosphere of Insomnia. Please let me know if you plan to attend so I can be sure we have table space available. You may view the event and RVSP on my facebook page.

Show Dates:
May 7th – June 2nd, 2013

Insomnia
563 Bloor St. W.
Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6
(416) 588-3907
Visit my website for more information

ArtBomb

I have recently been in talks with Artbomb, which is a Canadian online art auction. This website has daily auctions for unique Canadian artwork, each auction runs for 1 day only.

* Note this has been updated
The first painting we have decided to auction is Orange on Blue Chrome look for it to appear May 10th.

My piece At Ease is TBA…



 

 

In the Studio

Geo
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 24″ x 36″

Geo is a  little looser than my usual pixel paintings.
Geometric Pixels added with a palette knife.

In the Works 

I was inspired to start a new painting by the vast sand dunes and sky during my trip to Morocco. Please check out my blog here to get a clue as to what I am currently painting, it should be done for the Insomnia show.

title.rendered: Moroccan trip to Erg Chebbi Dunes and Transahara Festival

content.rendered: I have just returned from Morocco where I attended a Psytrance festival (Transahara) at the Erg Chebbi Dunes and roamed through the Medina of Marrakesh, what an amazing time I had. I did lots of exploring through Marrakesh, found some great treasures and had fun haggling with the vendors. At the Dunes it was all about enjoying the surroundings and dancing to house music and a bit of trance. Travelling from the Dunes I was just mesmerized by the Atlas Mountains. I took over 1000 photos and here I am sharing some of my favourites with you.

title.rendered: Art Show at Insomnia for the month of May

content.rendered:
I am pleased to announce that for the month of May my artwork will be on display at Insomnia Restaurant & Lounge on Bloor St. Toronto. I will be hanging on May 6th and open to the public on May 7th for 1 month. I have quite a bit of space at Insomnia and most of my work will be on display. It will be a good mix of my pixelated portrait and pattern paintings.

On May 7th there will be an informal reception at the Restaurant at 8 p.m. All are welcome to attend to come and enjoy the great food and atmosphere of Insomnia. Please let me know if you plan to attend so I can be sure we have table space available. You may view the event and facebook page.

Insomnia
563 Bloor St W.

title.rendered: My artwork soon to appear on Artbomb

content.rendered:
I have recently been in talks with Artbomb, which is a Canadian online art auction. This website has daily auctions for unique Canadian artwork, each auction runs for 1 day only.

The first painting we have decided to auction is Orange on Blue Chrome as seen to the right, look for it to appear May 10th.

My piece At Ease is scheduled for Saturday June 15th!
